metadata.title: How to Make Easy Tomato Rice- One Pot Rice Dish- Tastes Delicious- Indian Recipe
metadata.description:
Easy to make and delicious Tomato rice. Tomato rice made in a pressure cooker. Serve with raita, pappad and pickle. Easy Vegetarian rice dish.
Recipe: http://www.thasneen.com/cooking/easy-tomato-rice/
Connect with me via:
Fb: https://www.facebook.com/CookingwithThas/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/thasneen
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/thasneen/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/cookingwiththas/

transcription: [00:00.000] Prep time 5 mins, Cook time 25 mins, Total time 30 mins
[00:03.000] Author: Thasneen, Recipe type: Main, Cuisine: Indian, Serves: 4 People
[00:08.000] Ingredients to grind: Ginger 1 inch slice, Garlic 3 cloves, Green chilies 3, Whole cardamom 2, Whole cloves 2, Whole cinnamon 2 inch slice

[00:20.000] For cooking: Ghee 2 tbsp, Onion chopped 1, Tomatoes chopped 3, Kashmiri chili powder 1 tsp, Turmeric powder ⅛ tsp, Coriander powder 2 tsp, Garam Masala ¼ tsp, Salt 1¼ tsp, Basmati Rice 2 cups, Water 3¾ cups, Cilantro chopped ¼ cup
[00:40.000] In a blender or food processor, coarsely grind the ingredients 'to grind'.
[00:45.000] Place a pressure cooker over medium heat, add ghee.
[00:50.000] Add the ground mixture, sauté till golden.
[00:55.000] Add chopped onion, season with ½ tsp salt, sauté till onion turns golden.
[01:00.000] Add tomatoes, cook till tomatoes are slightly mashed.
[01:05.000] Add Kashmiri chili powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, garam masala and ¾ tsp more salt. Combine well and cook for 2 minutes.
[01:15.000] Add basmati rice, sauté for a minute.
[01:20.000] Add water and chopped cilantro, combine well.
[01:25.000] Cover the pressure cooker with its lid and place the whistle over it. Cook for 20 minutes till 1 or 2 whistles.
[01:35.000] Remove the cooker from heat, let the pressure subside, open lid.
[01:38.000] Let the tomato rice cool for 5 minutes. Serve along with raita, pappad, and pickle.
[01:42.000] Notes: If you don't have a pressure cooker, you could make this in a saucepan.
